statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Georgia Southern 66, Samford 59
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. -- Julian Allen scored 12 points and Georgia Southern rallied to defeat Samford 66-59 victory in both team's Southern Conference opener on Saturday night. The Eagles (3-3, 1-0) trailed 34-28 at halftime and fell behind 48-40 with 11:37 remaining. But Samford (3-3, 0-1), which had held its last four opponents -- including Ohio State -- to 59 points or fewer, couldn't stop the Eagles. Georgia Southern went on an 11-0 run to claim a 51-48 lead on a 3-pointer by Antonio Hanson with 5:57 left. The Bulldogs went 0-for-8 from the free-throw line in the last 4:38. Antoine Johnson added 10 points for the Eagles. Bryan Friday and Trey Montgomery scored 16 points apiece for the Bulldogs. Samford, which had held opponents to a shooting percentage of 38.5 percent, allowed Georgia Southern to make 26 of 60 shots from the field (43.3 percent).
